name: Questions on the Faust Legend Quiz | Fables and Fairy Tales | 5 Questions

questions.text: The Faust legend was derived from late medieval legends of what culture?
questions.explanation:
German.

	It is said that there was actually a German necromancer named Faust who was in league with the devil.

questions.text: What is the earliest known work dealing with the Faust legend?
questions.explanation:
Faustbuch.

	The Faustbuch was written anonymously in 1587.

questions.text: Faust was next handled by a famous playwright, who titled his work 'Doctor Faustus'. What was his name?
Perhaps the most famous version of Faust was written by a German poet and dramatist in the early 19th century. Who was this man?
questions.correct: Goethe & Johann Wolfgang von Goethe & Von Goethe & Johann Goethe & Johann Von Goethe
questions.explanation:
Goethe & Johann Wolfgang von Goethe & Von Goethe & Johann Goethe & Johann Von Goethe.

	In Goethe's work, as in Marlowe's, Faust flirts with the devil, in the guise of Mephistopheles.

questions.text: What German-born writer, who lived in America between 1939 and 1952, wrote a new version of Faust entitled 'Doktor Faustus' in 1947?
questions.explanation:
Mann.

	Thomas Mann used the Faust legend to describe the nihilistic tendencies in German culture during the early 20th century.
